verses.verse: Hear<WH6030> me when I call<WH7121>, O God<WH430> of my righteousness<WH6664>: you have relieved<WH7337> me when I was in distress<WH6862>; have mercy<WH2603> upon me<WH8085>, and hear my prayer<WH8605>.

O you sons<WH1121> of men<WH376>, how long<WH5704> will you turn my glory<WH3519> into shame<WH3639>? how long will you love<WH157> vanity<WH7385>, and seek<WH1245> after falsehood<WH3577>? Selah<WH5542>.
But know<WH3045> that the Lord<WH3068> has set apart<WH6395> him that is godly<WH2623> for himself<WH3068>: the Lord will hear<WH8085> when I call unto him<WH7121>.
Stand in awe<WH7264>, and sin<WH2398> not<WH559>: commune with your own heart<WH3824> upon your bed<WH4904>, and be still<WH1826>. Selah<WH5542>.
Offer<WH2076> the sacrifices<WH2077> of righteousness<WH6664>, and put your trust<WH982> in the Lord<WH3068>.
There be many<WH7227> that say<WH559>, Who will show<WH7200> us any good<WH2896>? Lord<WH3068>, lift you up<WH5375> the light<WH216> of your favor upon us<WH6440>.
You have put<WH5414> gladness<WH8057> in my heart<WH3820>, more than in the time<WH6256> that their corn<WH1715> and their wine<WH8492> increased<WH7231>.
I will both<WH3162> lay me down<WH7901> in peace<WH7965>, and sleep<WH3462>: for you<WH3068>, Lord, only<WH910> make me live<WH3427> in safety<WH983>.
